titleStmt.title: By the King, a proclamation. William R. Whereas in and by one Act made and passed in the last session of Parliament (intituled, An Act for granting an aid to His Majesty, as well by a land tax, as by several subsidies and other duties payable for one year) ...
titleStmt.author: England and Wales. Sovereign (1694-1702 : William III)

titleStmt.title: By the King, a proclamation. William R. Whereas in and by one Act made and passed in the last session of Parliament (intituled, An Act for granting an aid to His Majesty, as well by a land tax, as by several subsidies and other duties payable for one year) ...
titleStmt.author: England and Wales. Sovereign (1694-1702 : William III)
William III, King of England, 1650-1702.

publicationStmt.publisher: printed by Charles Bill, and the executrix of Thomas Newcomb, deceas'd; printers to the Kings most Excellent Majesty,

notesStmt.note: Recites the provisions of acts of the last session of Parliament by which the issue of Exchequer Bills for £1,500,000, bearing interest 5d. per £100 per diem, is regulated.
At end: Given at Our Court at Kensington the three and twentieth day of April, 1697. In the ninth year of Our Reign.
In this edition, the imprint ends: "Printers".
Reproduction of the original in the Harvard University Library.

person.persName: Charles Bill, and the executrix of Thomas Newcomb, deceas'd;
